Erik Spoelstra Parents are Jon Spoelstra and Elisa Celino. An American professional basketball coach is in charge of the Miami Heat in the National Basketball Association (NBA).

As the Heatâs head coach, he has two NBA championships to his name. Prior to playing professionally and coaching in Germany, Spoelstra participated in collegiate basketball with the Portland Pilots.

Spoelstra served as the Heatâs director of scouting and assistant coach from 2001 to 2008. The squad won the NBA Finals in 2006 during that time. He became the teamâs head coach for the 2008â2009 campaign.

LeBron James and Chris Bosh were signed by the Heat as free agents in 2010, and from 2011 through 2014, the Heat appeared in the NBA Finals four times in a row under Spoelstra.

They won the title in 2012 and 2013. In 2020, he made it to the NBA Finals for the fifth time as the head coach.

Erik Spoelstra Parents: Jon Spoelstra and Elisa Celino

The renowned American writer Jon Spoelstra and his wife Elisa Celino Spoelstra are the parents of Erik. Erik Spoelstraâs father, Jon Spoelstra, was the head coach of the Miami Heat and a well-known figure in American literature and sports.

He is an American author best known for his works Success is just one wish away, Do-Overs, Red Chaser, and The Ultimate Toolkit. Even the Wall Street Journal named Marketing Outrageously, Jon Spoelstraâs fifth book, a best-seller.

Erik Spoelstraâs father, Jon, ran professional sports organizations for the majority of his adult life until switching to the world of literature. He worked as an NBA executive with the New Jersey Nets, Buffalo Braves, Denver Nuggets, and Portland Trail Blazers before becoming an author.

Elisa Celino, the mother of the coach, is a native of San Pablo, Laguna, in the Philippines. When Jon was traveling for business, she met him in Manila. Jon was so deeply in love with Elisa that he believed he would settle down as a sheep farmer and stay in the Philippines with her.

Erik Spoelstraâs mother, on the other hand, advised him to finish his education. Two years later, the pair got married. Erikâs mother, was formerly a lecturer at Marawi State University. The public still does not know what Erik Spoelstraâs mother did when she stopped teaching.

Erik Spoelstra Ethnicity

The basketball coach is an ethnic Filipino-American. Spoelstra was born to Jon Spoelstra and Elisa Celino in Evanston, Illinois. Elisa is a San Pablo, Laguna, Philippines native, and Jon is a Dutch-Irish-American.

Spoelstra is the first Asian-American head coach to ever win an NBA championship as well as the first Asian-American head coach in the history of the four top North American sports leagues.

The basketball player was born and raised in Buffalo, New York, and by the late 1970s had relocated to Portland, Oregon.

Prior to enrolling at Jesuit High School in Beaverton, Oregon, where he thrived as a point guard for the basketball team, he attended Raleigh Hills Elementary and Whitford Jr. High School in Portland.

In memory of Terry Porter, a former TrailBlazer and one of his favorite NBA players, he wore number 30 throughout high school and college.

Erik Spoelstra Nationality

Erik Jon Spoelstra is an American citizen who was born in Evanston, Illinois, on November 1, 1970.

Spoelstra earned a communications degree from the University of Portland in 1992. Spoelstra packed shoes at a Nike warehouse after earning a communications degree from the University of Portland.

The following two years (1993â1955) were spent working for the Westphalian professional basketball team TuS Herten as a player-assistant coach in the Basketball Bundesligaâs second tier. As the head coach of the clubâs neighborhood youth squad, Spoelstra was given his first coaching position.

The basketball coach received a second two-year contract offer from the team in 1995, but he was also given a job opportunity by the Miami Heat of the NBA. He decided to accept the Heat position even though both offers were attractive.
